      • imagesFile

        public java.io.InputStream imagesFile()
        Gets the imagesFile. An image file (.jpg, .png) or .zip file with images. Include no more than 20 images and limit the .zip file to 5 MB. You can also include images with the `url` property in the **parameters** object.
        Returns:
        the imagesFile

      • imagesFilename

        public java.lang.String imagesFilename()
        Gets the imagesFilename. The filename for imagesFile.
        Returns:
        the imagesFilename

      • parameters

        public java.lang.String parameters()
        Gets the parameters. Specifies input parameters. The parameter can include these inputs in a JSON object: - url: A string with the image URL to analyze. You can also include images in the **images_file** parameter. - classifier_ids: An array of classifier IDs to classify the images against. - owners: An array with the values IBM, me, or both to specify which classifiers to run. - threshold: A floating point value that specifies the minimum score a class must have to be displayed in the response. For example: {"url": "...", "classifier_ids": ["...","..."], "owners": ["IBM", "me"], "threshold": 0.4}
        Returns:
        the parameters

      • acceptLanguage

        public java.lang.String acceptLanguage()
        Gets the acceptLanguage. Specifies the language of the output class names. Can be `en` (English), `ar` (Arabic), `de` (German), `es` (Spanish), `it` (Italian), `ja` (Japanese), or `ko` (Korean). Classes for which no translation is available are omitted. The response might not be in the specified language under these conditions: - English is returned when the requested language is not supported. - Classes are not returned when there is no translation for them. - Custom classifiers returned with this method return tags in the language of the custom classifier.
        Returns:
        the acceptLanguage

      • imagesFileContentType

        public java.lang.String imagesFileContentType()
        Gets the imagesFileContentType. The content type of imagesFile. Values for this parameter can be obtained from the HttpMediaType class.
        Returns:
        the imagesFileContentType
